Reviews.Title: Best 10Mpix Camera for under $50
Reviews.Author: Felipe Calderoff

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3HKFF50T9P1OAcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3HKFF50T9P1OAcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:12 MinsI ordered this camera and then gulped when I read the reviews. However, I soon realized that the complaints were basically from people who cannot put in the batteries correctly or adjust the camera settings for color temperature. This camera worked perfectly right out of the package and takes pictures with vivid colors. I have posted a picture taken outside my front door 30 minutes after unwrapping the camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: Beverly
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS AWFUL!!! I bought it to replace my old Kodiak camera (Which I actually really liked) and for the same price, I bought this Vivitar camera. I thought it would be just as good... WRONG!!! This camera dosent even have a lens, and even though it is 10 mp, my old $20 dollar camera from walgreens is better than this!!! I have never dropped it and now the screens broken. Whenever I turn it on the screen is just white. It is a very cheap camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY:  Not a Real Camera!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in a store for my daughter the night before leaving on a vacation -- to replace a Kodak camera that had been dropped and broken.  I paid about the same as I did for the Kodak online, about $50 or $60.  The Kodak was actually a very nice little camera for the price, and I hoped the Vivitar X018 would do about as well.  In short, NOT!!!  This is a very strange product, really more a toy camera, but to me almost seems like a fake product.  It has all the electronic features you'd expect in a real camera.  However, it seems to be missing the most important feature of any camera:  a LENS.  It claims to have a "digital lens".  My guess looking at it is that it's a pin-hole lens, or very nearly so.  Anyhow, whatever the cause, even under the most benign conditions, the image quality is simply appalling.  It doesn't matter if it has 10 Megapixels:  These images would look awful at VGA or NTSC resolution.  I am simply astounded at the difference between the Kodak and the Vivitar for the very same price.  Worst of all was the tragedy of hundreds of utterly worthless pictures my daughter took to capture a special family vacation.  In summary:  THIS IS NOT A REAL CAMERA.  DO NOT BUY ONE!!!

Reviews.Title: Save your money!
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: I saw this advertised as a "door buster deal" on black friday. It was quite cheap for a 10mpx camera so I went for it. I wish I'd just stayed home or spent my money on something else. While this camera has many settings that I've fiddled with over and over, the image quality is always the same: horrible!! It's really no better than the old phone I had with 1.3mpx quality. In fact, I think the phone took better photos. Seriously, this camera is complete junk and a waste of your money. I have a GE 8mpx camera that takes spectacular photos and videos, far superior to this vivitar junk. Again, don't waste your money on this! If I could give it negative stars, I would!!

Reviews.Title: Broken on day one.
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for her 9th birthday thinking it would be a good first camera. It wouldn't power on after I inserted the batteries. Finally pushed the battery cover on tighter and it turned on. After one day of use it no longer works. It rolled off a chair on the the ground and now it will not turn on. Now I get the joy of trying to return it.

Reviews.Title: Broken upon arrival
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Cheaply made!  Learned my lesson when was wrapping gift for Christmas present 2 days before christmas and could not get camera to work at all, not even turn on!  I had to go out on Christmas Eve to buy another camera.  Learned my lesson and got a much better phone that will last longer than this camera even if it had worked.

Reviews.Title: Vivitar Vivicam X018 - YUCK!
Reviews.Author: kenneth
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps the worst camera I have ever seen.  Your OLD cell phone camera's would do circles around this product.  I bought it at Kmart and had high hopes that my mother would finally get a nice digital camera.  Not expecting a lot because this was her first but after seeing the pictures from this camera I thought it was a joke.  I'd call it a toy camera but I don't think it would even qualify for that.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!  I gave it one star only because I couldn't give it a negative rating!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.... and that would be complete crap.
Reviews.Author: killerdodo "killerdodo"
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty bad. I wasn't expecting much from it though. I can never get it to take good photos. It always has a tint, or miscoloration in areas. I have tried with and without flash, and I can never get good photos with any settings. The bottom line is, you'll get what you pay for. If you buy a $50 camera expecting much, ESPECIALLY from vivitar, you will be disappointed. I have always had issues with vivitar cameras being horrible for the price you pay. Bottom line, move away from vivitar, and towards other better brands. I have not seen a single good vivitar camera.But for the price... It will get a 2/5, just because its pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: MLE SILVIYA TONCHEVA ST
Reviews.Content: i like red color,it works fine,I hope it will keep more then 2 years.I will recommend vivitar cameras to friends.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend against anyone buying this camera
Reviews.Author: rocker
Reviews.Content: I am very unhappy with the quality of any photo except outdoors in full daylight.  I will probably throw it into the trash within days of today.  No available settings solve the indoor or indoor flash problems.  Grainy, nasty indoors, or with flash overexposed.Save your money.

Reviews.Title: cam
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: it is a very nice cam I love it. it  is great to have for vido or pic.great one to have

Reviews.Title: Woefully Unhappy
Reviews.Author: bunnylover
Reviews.Content: We just bought this camera today and are very disappointed. So far, we have set up the camera (date and time, etc) six times. After that, it won't let us take a picture or do anything. Upon calling customer service, they said the camera was frozen, which is typical for the camera. Customer service was obviously based in India, which makes it a bit difficult to understand as his accent was very strong and he did not wish to speak slower or more clearly.  The customer service was rude, inconsiderate, and hard to understand, and they did nothing to help us. Vivitar is a company I will never support in the future, as their product was defective (which their own customer service stated was "typical" of their camera) and their customer service offered nothing but take it back to the store in which it was purchased.

Reviews.Title: not a good buy!
Reviews.Author: Abigail
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my Kodak easyshare! I now have a greater appreciation for an easyshare! not good quality.

Reviews.Title: WORSE DIGICAM EVER
Reviews.Author: crashoverride
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a week ago, and i regret buying it. Its actually a toy camera. I think its actually a fake. Everything is soo strange about this camera. I've made the worse bargain ever. Pls amazon don't let this people sell this camera on your site.Vivitar ViviCam X018 - Digital camera - compact - 10.1 Mpix - supported memory: SD, SDHC - strawberry

Reviews.Title: Only good when it wants to be.
Reviews.Author: ThePos
Reviews.Content: You can follow the instructions to a T and your photos will still turn out blurry or look slightly pixelated. don't be fooled by it's price or 10.1 megapixels. I shoots like a 2.1 camera and rarely looks as it should. Even after I set the lighting and used a tripod to take a photo it still turned out blurry and yellow. On a day when you can communicate with this camera and beg it to do what you have asked you may get a clear picture (but not as clear as it should be), but the lighting will almost always be off. All of the pictures I took still had to be put through photoshop. If you are thinking about getting this camera because you're on a budget, don't. This camera is only good if it's received as a hand-me-down.

Reviews.Title: Never worked well - now, not at all.
Reviews.Author: peachypea
Reviews.Content: This camera was given to my daughter last year.  It never worked well.  The battery compartment was very difficult to close, even for me.  The pictures it took were poor in quality (even if taken by an adult).  It seemed to burn through batteries at an incredible speed.  Now it won't even turn on with brand new batteries in it.  Do not buy.  I will avoid this brand in the future.

Reviews.Title: buy a $30 camera phone instead!!
Reviews.Author: chiflatin
Reviews.Content: I have a 4MP Panasonic which I have been using for 4 years now and the pictures are incredible it makes 20"x30" prints which I sometimes peddle at art shows.  This piece of junk Vivitar which I got in the mail this afternoon was so terrible I nearly smashed it on principal, instead of getting my money back, just so some poor sap won't just buy it again. (no issue with the seller or Amazon, I got it fast and in perfect condition).I took a picture on a tripod in a medium lit room with both these cameras and compared. The result was a great photo from my other camera and a picture that was equivalent to a 2MP photo that was enlarged to 10MP from the Vivitar. It uses every trick in the book to dither it up to the biggest blurry crappy photo it can.I understand this camera costs less than $50 and I'm never gonna try and compare it to an actual camera, which is why I'm comparing to my 4 year old 4MP Lumix which isn't a real camera either in my book. But if even my Virgin Mobile camera phone can take better photos then the XO18 then there's a problem! The reason I actually purchased this was so I can begin taking staging photos and test videos for some other project. I just needed a cheap camera to capture a low-medium quality video with sound and be able to take a picture and the flip screen seemed useful. The sound is muffled at best from 3 feet away, movements are choppy and when you blink the camera records it as your eyes being closed for a whole second. Also the sound is not synced with the video. This is while using a faster SDHC card.I think my point is clear and I agree with any other reviewers indicating this thing is terrible. Just bear in mind that for around $100 you can buy other convenient snap-and-shoot cameras with FAR superior quality picture and video.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camara if you know what your doing!
Reviews.Author: Maude A. Bajdo "cntrygrl70"
Reviews.Content: I have to agree 100% with killerdodo's review. We bought our two boys this as an upgrade from those cheap crappy $20 WalMart camaras. I have one complaint and that is it is made of plastic. Hello VIVITAR get with it! But it does included that handy little wrist strap so use it.My boys have had their camaras for three months now and they still work great. You do need to purchase batteries and a memory card which it does say on the box. My oldest loves that handy little flip screen so that you can take your own picture and video yourself. Thet are learning the settings quickly and are starting to take some pretty nice photos.Overall get to know the camara and learn what settings take the best pictures for what conditions. I would recommend reading the two books by Jim Miotke called The BetterPhoto Guide to Digital Photography. One is about digital camaras and the other is about taking better nature pictures. So my last comment is learn the camara and you could be suprised at what the item can do. Maybe not as great as the most expensive ones but not bad either!

Reviews.Title: This camera is crap!
Reviews.Author: UsingAcrobatNow
Reviews.Content: It takes either blurry blue and white or yellow and white pictures.  I read through the manual for several hours and still couldn't get it to work.  I feel sorry for people who take this camera on vacation to find later all their pictures are crap.  Do not buy this thing.  I bought a new camera GE which worked fine no problems.  I felt guilty donating this to charity (even though it "worked") so I just recycled it.  IT is a waste of time AND money.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.1 Megapixel resolution
Anti-shake
Red eye reduction tools
4x Digital Zoom
ProductInfo.Name: Vivitar ViviCam X018 - Strawberry (VX018-RH)
